articles.title: World people praise G.S. Kim Jong Il as military genius
articles.content:
World people praise G.S. Kim Jong Il as military genius
 Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- The 6th anniversary of General Kim Jong Il's election as Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army was celebrated in different countries.
   Celebration meetings were held in Egypt, Uganda, Guinea and Nepal.
   Meanwhile, lecture meetings, a reading session and film shows were sponsored by the pan-African movement in Uganda, the Dar-Es-Salaam, Tanzania, group for the study of Kimilsungism, the Ilala, Dar-Es-Salaam, district committee of the revolutionary party of Tanzania, the group for the study of the Juche idea of comrade Kim Il Sung in Enmore, Guyana, "Dastan" Complex of Kyrgyzstan and the Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, group for the study of the Juche idea.
   Present at the meetings were political and public figures and other people.
   It was stressed at the meetings that General Kim Jong Il, KPA Supreme Commander, is a military genius, who has always attached importance to the army building and built the army as the main force of the revolution.
   It was also said that the prospect of the Korean people and people's army led by  General Kim Jong Il is bright and they will surely repulse the imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle them, reunify the divided country and accomplish the socialist cause.
   In another development, an evening was held in Russia to celebrate the 6th anniversary of General Kim Jong Il's election as KPA Supreme Commander and the 80th birth anniversary of mother Kim Jong Suk, a communist revolutionary fighter.

articles.title: Pictures of three generals of Mt. Paektu distributed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Pictures of three generals of Mt. Paektu distributed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Cards carrying pictures of the three great persons of Mt. Paektu were recently distributed to houses in Taegum-dong and Taeui-dong, eastern district, Kwangju city, South Korea, the Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation quoted information of the Kwangju city committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea as saying.
   The envelopes containing those picture cards were mailed in the name of the Paektu society. 
   Printed on the front side of each card are letters "Let us boast of and uphold the three generals from Mt. Paektu, the most famous mountain in the world" against the background of Mt. Paektu at sunrise.
   Carried on its back are pictures of the three generals in army uniform, with letters "ever-victorious brilliant commander Kim Il Sung", "peerlessly brilliant commander  Kim Jong Il" and "heroine of Paektu General Kim Jong Suk".
   Seeing the pictures, people expressed deep reverence for the great men and woman of the nation, the information said.

articles.title: Undying guideline for party's ideological work
articles.content:
Undying guideline for party's ideological work
 Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Teachings given by President Kim Il Sung on January 3, Juche 57 (1968) are an undying work that has brought about a fundamental change in the party's ideological work, stresses Rodong Sinmun in a by-lined article today.
   The author of the article says:
   The ideas and theories expounded in the work, including the ideas on thoroughly establishing the party's monolothic ideological system in all party and whole society and on enhancing the socialist patriotic education among party members and working people, marked a milestone for effecting an epochal change in the ideological work of the Workers' Party of Korea.
   Absolute worship of the Korean people for their leader has come from the principle of the revolutionary outlook on the leader set forth by President Kim Il Sung in the work.
   The invincible singlehearted unity of all party and whole society also represents the vitality of the ideas and theories on establishing the party's ideological system contained in the work.
   The ideas and theories on communist education, the revolutionary education and the class education advanced in the work serve as an undying guideline for the WPK's ideological work.

articles.title: Greetings to Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President
 Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- The Central People's Committee of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea sent a message of greetings on January 1 to Muhammad Rafiq Tarar upon his assumption of office as the President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan.
   It expresses the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations existing between the two countries will further strengthen and develop in the future and sincerely wishes him greater success in his work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.
